marketNews.title: BI Holds Interest Rate, Prediction of 50 Bps FFR Cut in 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (8/21) decided to maintain the reference interest rate at the BI Rate level of 6.25%, with the deposit facility and lending facility also maintained at 5.5% and 7% respectively. This decision is in line with consensus expectations. Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that this decision is in line with the strategy of further strengthening the stabilization of the Rupiah exchange rate in Q3 2024. Perry also mentioned that the central bank still sees the opportunity for a BI Rate cut in Q4 2024. Perry said that Bank Indonesia projects the US central bank, the Fed, will conduct 2 cuts to the US interest rate (Fed Fund Rate/FFR) totaling -50 bps until the end of 2024. For comparison, the economist consensus compiled by Bloomberg expects the Fed to cut rates by -75 bps until the end of 2024. In line with increasing expectations for a Fed rate cut, the bond and stock markets in Indonesia experienced inflows of IDR 23.7 trillion and IDR 6.6 trillion respectively since the beginning of August 2024. The re-entry of foreign funds into the Indonesian capital market has also pushed up the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar by +4.8% Month to Date (MTD) to the level of 15,485 per August 21, 2024. Key Takeaway: The significant strengthening of the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar recently is increasingly loosening the room for Bank Indonesia to start cutting interest rates, although it seems it will still wait for the Fed's rate cut first. As previously written in Stockbit Commentary, the prospect of interest rate cuts and the strengthening of the Rupiah exchange rate will provide a positive sentiment for the property and consumer sectors. Several property and consumer stocks have strengthened significantly in the last 1 month, including PWON (+11.9%), SMRA (+14.29%), ICBP (+6.02%), and INDF (+9.05%).

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia records that banking credit disbursement grew +12.4% YoY during 7M24 (vs. 1H24: +12.36% YoY). Credit growth was mainly supported by investment credit (+15.2% YoY), working capital credit (+11.6% YoY), and consumption credit (+10.98% YoY). Meanwhile, sharia financing during 7M24 grew +11.75% YoY and MSME credit growth reached +5.16% YoY. Bank Indonesia projects credit growth in 2024 will be at the upper range of the target of around +10-12%.

marketNews.title: DPR Legislation Body Annuls Constitutional Court Ruling Regarding Candidate Thresholds for Regional Elections
marketNews.content: Bisnis reported that the DPR Legislation Body decided to annul the Constitutional Court's ruling regarding the threshold requirement for nomination in regional head elections (pilkada). This decision is stated in the inventory of problems (DIM) list for the Regional Election Bill which was discussed on Wednesday (8/21). The plan is that the DIM for the Regional Election Bill discussed by the DPR Legislation Body will be submitted to the plenary session tomorrow, Thursday (8/22). If the Legislation Body's decision is passed by the DPR plenary session, then PDIP will certainly not be able to nominate regional head candidates in the 2024 Jakarta regional election and several other regions.

marketNews.title: DPR Rejects Constitutional Court Ruling on Minimum Age Requirement for Regional Heads
marketNews.content: CNN Indonesia reported that the DPR Legislation Body decided to annul the Constitutional Court's ruling which mandated the age requirement for regional heads to be calculated upon the announcement of candidate pairs. This decision is stated in the inventory of problems (DIM) list for the Regional Election Bill which was discussed on Wednesday (8/21). The plan is that the DIM for the Regional Election Bill discussed by the DPR Legislation Body will be submitted to the plenary session tomorrow, Thursday (8/22). If the Legislation Body's decision is passed by the DPR plenary session, then Kaesang Pangarep - the son of President Joko Widodo who is rumored to be nominated by the Advanced Indonesia Coalition as a candidate for Deputy Governor of Central Java - can participate in the regional election.

marketNews.title: Golkar Party Officially Appoints Bahlil Lahadalia as Chairman for 2024-2029 Period
marketNews.content: The Golkar Party officially appointed the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, as Chairman for the 2024-2029 period on Wednesday (8/21). Four anonymous sources from the Golkar Party told Reuters that Bahlil's appointment could help President Joko Widodo secure his legacy after Prabowo Subianto takes power. The Presidential Staff Office has not yet responded to requests for comment on this issue.

marketNews.title: Luhut Guarantees Evaluation of Aircraft Ticket Price Reduction Will Be Completed This Month
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated that the process for reducing aircraft ticket prices will be completed in August 2024. Luhut mentioned that the National Aviation Ticket Price Supervision Committee is considering several factors to lower aircraft ticket prices, one of which is opening opportunities for other parties to supply jet fuel (avtur) for domestic airlines. Luhut stated that avtur supply is currently done by Pertamina, causing avtur prices to become uncompetitive.

marketNews.title: Government Plans to Shut Down 2 GW Capacity at Suralaya Coal Power Plant Complex to Curb Pollution
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated that the government plans to shut down 2 GW of capacity at the Suralaya Coal-Fired Power Plant (PLTU) complex in Banten to address air pollution in Jakarta. The Suralaya PLTU is owned by PLN and has a total installed capacity of 4 GW. On the other hand, PLN plans to add 2 GW capacity at the complex by developing a more modern PLTU through a joint venture with Barito Pacific (BRPT), PT Indo Raya Tenaga. The new electricity facility is targeted to start operating by the end of August 2024.

marketNews.title: SOE Corporate Actions Await New Government Transition; SOE Construction Holding Expected in October 2024
marketNews.content: Special Staff to the Minister of SOEs, Arya Sinulingga, stated that they are waiting for the new government transition to carry out SOE corporate actions such as mergers and IPOs. Arya also mentioned that the establishment of the State-Owned Construction Holding is expected to be realized in October 2024. Previously, the Minister of SOEs, Erick Thohir, stated that he could not determine when the formation of the State-Owned Construction Holding would be completed because the policy still awaits a review from the Ministry of PUPR.

tickerNews.title: Government Plans to Increase Public Ownership in BRIS Amid Lack of Strategic Investor Candidates
tickerNews.content: BRIS: Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, told Investor Daily that the ministry is now planning to increase the public ownership portion in Bank Syariah Indonesia, considering there is currently no candidate strategic investor that will enter BRIS. On the other hand, BRIS President Director, Hery Gunardi, declined to comment regarding the rumored rights issue to increase the public ownership portion. Previously, the Ministry of SOEs planned to reduce the ownership stakes of Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) in BRIS, which currently own 23.24% and 15.38% respectively.

tickerNews.title: MCAS Plans Share Buyback of Up to 30.1 Million Shares with IDR 90.7 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: MCAS: M Cash Integrasi plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 30.1 million shares or 3.5% of the issued and paid-up capital from September 26, 2024, to September 25, 2025. The total buyback fund allocation reaches IDR 90.7 billion, with a maximum buyback price of IDR 3,000 per share. This plan will be discussed at the EGM (RUPSLB) on September 26, 2024.

tickerNews.title: KPIG Files Objection with IDX Against Suspension of Trading that Commenced on August 20, 2024
tickerNews.content: KPIG: MNC Land has filed an objection with the IDX against the temporary suspension of trading that began on August 20, 2024. KPIG management stated that the company does not meet the suspension conditions as stipulated in the stock exchange regulations. Furthermore, KPIG management did not find a reference used by the IDX to halt the company's stock trading. The IDX itself, in its announcement, stated that the suspension of KPIG stock trading was caused by a significant increase in stock price and was intended as investor protection.

tickerNews.title: BJTM Announces IDR 100 Billion Capital Injection into NTB Syariah Bank for Bank Business Group Formation
tickerNews.content: BJTM: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur announced that it has made a capital injection of IDR 100 billion to PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Nusa Tenggara Barat Syariah. This transaction is intended for the formation of a bank business group (KUB) between BJTM and Bank NTB Syariah. Following this transaction, the financial statements of Bank NTB Syariah will be consolidated into BJTM.

tickerNews.title: MYOR CEO Andre Sukendra Atmadja Purchased 450,000 MYOR Shares Increasing His Stake to 0.011%
tickerNews.content: MYOR: Mayora Indah President Director, Andre Sukendra Atmadja, purchased 450,000 MYOR shares at an average price of IDR 2,685.6 per share on August 16-19, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 1.21 billion. After this transaction, Andre Sukendra Atmadja's ownership in MYOR increased from 0.009% to 0.011%.

tickerNews.title: BDKR Director Tan Franciscus Bought 7.1 Million Shares in a Transaction Valued at IDR 5.4 Billion
tickerNews.content: BDKR: Berdikari Pondasi Perkasa Director, Tan Franciscus, bought 7.1 million BDKR shares at an average price of IDR 765 per share on August 15, 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 5.4 billion. After this transaction, Tan Franciscus's ownership in BDKR increased from 0.45% to 0.6%.

tickerNews.title: BPII Adds Paid-in Capital to Subsidiary and Plans to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of IDR 45 Billion
tickerNews.content: BPII: Batavia Prosperindo Internasional announced that it has made a paid-in capital addition of approximately SGD 1.7 million or IDR 20 billion to its subsidiary, Batavia Prosperindo Pte. Ltd. Furthermore, BPII also plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to IDR 45 billion or IDR 4.55 per share, indicating a dividend yield of 0.9% as of Wednesday (8/21). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is August 29, 2024, with payment on September 20, 2024.
